polls.question: When tension starts, what do you usually do first?

insights.A: Withdrawing can protect you short-term, but repair requires re-entry: return with one clear sentence.
insights.B: Clarity is powerful when it’s calm. Try: “I want to understand, not win.”
insights.C: Humor can de-escalate, but don’t use it to dodge the real issue. Name the feeling gently.
insights.D: Your pattern is flexible—build a consistent repair habit so tension doesn’t linger.
